headline: Closing Bell Movers: Tesla jumps on Musk plans to pare back his DOGE work
summary: In the opening hour of the evening session, U.S. equity futures are sharply higher, tacking on to broad-based gains seen during Tuesday’s regular hours. S&P 500 futures are up 1.6% above 5,400, Nasdaq 100 is up 2% above 18,700, and Dow Industrials are up 1.4% just shy of 40,000. headline: This Oil Services Stock Should Be Able to Weather 2025
summary: Almost all of the oil services stocks have been a terrible bet this year—even worse than producers.  Halliburton Liberty Energy SLB  and  Baker Hughes  are all down by double-digit percentages.  The one firm that looks like it can weather the problems is  Baker Hughes  which reported earnings results late on Tuesday.

headline: Baker Hughes forecasts drop in producer spending as tariffs pinch demand
summary: HOUSTON (Reuters) -U.S. oilfield service provider Baker Hughes on Wednesday forecast steeper drops in spending by global oil producers as tariffs dent demand expectations and push down prices for crude.  Baker Hughes echoed rival Halliburton's concerns on Tuesday, that weak oil prices could push down oilfield activity in North America.  Houston-based Baker Hughes, which reported better-than-expected first-quarter profit on Tuesday, now expects global upstream spending to be down by high-single digits in 2025.

headline: Tariff Concerns Weigh on Baker Hughes Outlook
summary: Baker Hughes expresses caution about its financial outlook due to macroeconomic and trade policy uncertainty, reporting a decline in profits and estimating a potential tariff impact.
